mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lord, Joseph, 1762-1844
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Importance of militia justifies his presumption; as commander-in-chief Jefferson introduces rules of discipline; encloses a manuscript for his consideration; a military catechism for young children would excite their ambition; requests an opinion.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1804 January 18, Canaan, [New York] to Thomas Jefferson, [Washington D.C.].
